Mutineers.synopsis: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
Mutineers.how_to_trigger: Go to UND GrymforgeRepro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -644 3614. go up the stair and talk to Elder Brithvar

LoyalFollowUp.synopsis: Player has sided with Nere, but Nere and Thrinn are dead by the time combat is over. In that case, a duergar initiates dialogue and tells you his plans and you get to decide the gnomes' fate.
LoyalFollowUp.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -625.75, 14.74, 354.754. Talk with Elder Brithvar, convince him you are not a true soul (deception roll) and accept to help him.5. CTRL-Shift-K the Scrying eye.6. Destroy the rubbles holding Nere captive.7. Side with Nere in the mutiny (let Thrinn be killed) but resolve the combat by killing Nere and the rebels.8. Walk back to the main room, dialog should start afterward.

ElevatorWarning.synopsis: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby duergar butt in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
ElevatorWarning.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -605.444; 5.317; 3844. Click on the grilled door.teleport S_UND_Elevator_Fort_FromShadowlands

Rothe_01.synopsis: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
Rothe_01.how_to_trigger: 1. use Recon command : "loadlevel WLD_Main_A"2. goto -656.42, 10.00, 395.033. Ctrl-K (kill) the Elder RotheYou can now talk to Calf and you will need speak with animal to understand..

RebelGreedyExtort.synopsis: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
RebelGreedyExtort.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -644 3614. Walk up the stairs and walk towards the 2 Duergar at the top of the stairs5. Talk to the Duergar and chose to side with him and ambush the Drow Nere6. Clear the cave in ctrl+shift+K on the cave in7. Cinematic will trigger > choose option " that's your cue.." then side with the Duergar and the rebbels and kill Nere

RotheDiscussion.synopsis: This occurs between two Rothe. The first is a younger Rothe who desires  freedom and a life without pain. The other Rothe is older and more stern. He has worked since the times of Ketheric.Player can speak with them or listen in on their conversation with an animal handling check.
RotheDiscussion.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -656.28; 10.051; 398.3184. Talk with either Rothe

RebelsExtort.synopsis: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
RebelsExtort.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -625.75, 14.74, 354.754. Talk with Elder Brithvar, convince him you are not a true soul (deception roll) and accept to help him.5. CTRL-Shift-K the Scrying eye.6. Destroy the rubbles holding Nere captive.7. Side with Brithvar and use CTRL-Shift_K to kill Brithvar and all of the loyals + Nere.8. Walk to the center of the main room.

Mutineers_FollowUp.synopsis: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.
Mutineers_FollowUp.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -625.75, 14.74, 354.754. Talk with Elder Brithvar, convince him you are not a true soul (deception roll) and accept to help him for a fee (half the gold - persuasion roll).5. CTRL-Shift-K the Scrying eye.6. Destroy the rubbles holding Nere captive.7. Side with Brithvar and use killcombat to kill all of the loyals + Nere.8. Talk with Brithvar

Rothe_03.synopsis: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.

Checkpoint.synopsis: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
Checkpoint.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:ARRIVE WITH GREYMON1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -4.60, 0.21, -208.224. Cinematic starts > choose attack him5. killcombat6. Click on raft7. Wait for cinematic to start 8. roll amazing9. Choose the 1st roll and pass it (Greymon will follow you)ARRIVE WITHOUT GREYMON1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -4.60, 0.21, -208.224. Cinematic starts > choose attack him5. killcombat6. Click on raft7. roll terrible8. killcombat9. Click on rudder > choose to continue

Rothe_02.synopsis: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.

HangedDrow_Dead.synopsis: Player finds drow corpse hanging in a cage in Grymforge. When you click on it you discover that it was a Harper who came here, and could get some foreshadowing about Last Light and the name Jaheira.

ElevatorWarningGnome.synopsis: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.synopsis: The mutinous duergar is dead, so another takes his place to tells you they are moving on

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Reviewing the sessions reveals a few chains and branching paths. First, the three Nere coercion sessions share a numeric sequence in their names (Nere_AD_Coercion_1, then _2, then _3) and are all triggered in combat using the same target. It is logical to enforce the order: Coercion_1 must occur before Coercion_2, and Coercion_2 before Coercion_3. Next, regarding the duergar mutiny branch, the session “Mutineers” initiates a mutiny (and may lead to further consequences) and is later followed by “Mutineers_FollowUp” in which the duergar explains what comes next. In this branch the player’s choices diverge: one path involves siding with Nere (the “LoyalFollowUp” branch) while another results in extortion scenes (“RebelGreedyExtort” or “RebelsExtort”) or additional follow‐up if the primary mutineer dies (“Mutineers_GroupFollowUp”). Thus these follow‐up dialogues from the mutiny/loyalty branch are mutually exclusive – choosing one outcome means the others will not appear. In another pair, “ElevatorWarning” (triggered when a duergar comments) and “ElevatorWarningGnome” (triggered when a gnome comments) are alternative NPC interventions and cannot occur in the same playthrough. Finally, among the Rothe sessions there is “Rothe_01” (which involves the younger Rothe in a moment that leads to a kill and conversation with Calf) and “RotheDiscussion” (a dialogue between a younger and an older Rothe). Given that one outcome involves removing one of the rothe to eventually speak to Calf (thus precluding a mutual discussion), these two sessions are exclusive. (Other Rothe sessions such as Rothe_02 and Rothe_03 do not have clear ordering or exclusivity constraints with the others based solely on the available synopsis.)

Mutineers_83.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers_102.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_102.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers_134.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers_134.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers_23.speaker: Elder Brithvar

Mutineers_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers_133.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_133.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers_30.speaker: Player
Mutineers_30.text: Why would you think I'm a True Soul?

Mutineers_45.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_45.text: The stench - all you Twat-Souls got one. Some of us got a nose for it.

Mutineers_11.speaker: Player
Mutineers_11.text: You want my gold? Then you'll have to fight me for it.

Mutineers_103.speaker: Player
Mutineers_103.text: Don't be absurd. I hate these True Soul cultists.

Mutineers_39.speaker: Player
Mutineers_39.text: These True Souls are my enemies, not my allies.

Mutineers_37.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_37.text: Yet you got that Twat-Soul stench.

Mutineers_100.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_100.text: If I didn't know better, I'd say a mind flayer shat a worm in your brain.

Mutineers_108.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_108.text: Should split your head open and poke around in there if you lot don't pay up.

Mutineers_7.speaker: Player
Mutineers_7.text: A stench? Ridiculous. I'm no more a True Soul than you are.

Mutineers_51.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers_51.text: *The shiver returns. This time, it's colder. Sharper.*
Mutineers_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers_3.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_3.text: The stench don't lie. You're one of them.

Mutineers_78.speaker: Player
Mutineers_78.text: That's not me you smell. You must still be catching Nere's scent.

Mutineers_48.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_48.text: He stinks to the deepest Hells, that's for sure. Could be you're right.

Mutineers_66.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_66.text: In that case - want to earn some gold?

Mutineers_4.speaker: Player
Mutineers_4.text: What gold? I thought you hadn't been paid yet.

Mutineers_18.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_18.text: Ain't my gold I'm offering. It's the True Soul's.

Mutineers_26.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_26.text: Thrinn's after the Absolute's glory - that's why she's got those slaves digging for Nere.

Mutineers_1.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_1.text: But we ain't need glory - just coin. And Nere's got plenty.

Mutineers_70.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_70.text: Help Thrinn free Nere - then you and my chums grind him up.

Mutineers_84.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_84.text: Whatever the spoils, we'll drop you a fat cut. You in?

Mutineers_117.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_117.text: Good. But first we need to take care of something.

Mutineers_76.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_76.text: Good. Reckon the gnomes are key to busting Nere out.

Mutineers_77.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_77.text: Just what I like to hear.

Mutineers_87.speaker: Player
Mutineers_87.text: Good plan. I think Sergeant Thrinn should know about it.

Mutineers_126.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_126.text: Drugnin' shithead - like hell she should!

Mutineers_132.speaker: Player
Mutineers_132.text: Sounds good. I expect half the spoils.

Mutineers_128.speaker: Player
Mutineers_128.text: I'm worth more than a 'cut'. I want half.

Mutineers_86.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_86.context: NodeContext: Rising anger. About to say DRUG-nin RAK-kah. 'Fucking tool'

Mutineers_58.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_58.text: Fine. Half it is. But first we need to take care of something.
Mutineers_58.context: NodeContext: Calms himself down with a sigh.

Mutineers_91.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_91.text: You seen that weird orb-eye floatin' about?

Mutineers_80.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_80.text: Knife it. And don't get caught.

Mutineers_25.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_25.text: The cult watches through it. And we can't risk more Twat-Souls showing up.

Mutineers_109.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_109.text: You still standing about? Get on it!

Mutineers_130.speaker: Player
Mutineers_130.text: I asked about a lead. And you still haven't answered.

Mutineers_49.speaker: Player
Mutineers_49.text: Any ideas on getting Nere out?

Mutineers_10.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_10.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

Mutineers_5.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_5.text: Her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

Mutineers_29.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_29.text: Now move. You're hogging my air.

Mutineers_97.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_97.text: No clue where the stump's hiding. But she's got what you need.

Mutineers_61.speaker: Player
Mutineers_61.text: I've obtained explosive powder. That should open the tunnel.

Mutineers_92.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_92.text: Good. Drop it near the rubble when it's time. Flaming arrow or some such'll set it off.

Mutineers_52.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_52.text: Fine. Half it is. But you need to bust Nere out first.

Mutineers_60.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_60.text: Once you blast Nere out, we'll chop him into chunks and take our dues.

Mutineers_42.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_42.text: Half? Drugnin' rakkah. Should split your skull for the insult.
Mutineers_42.context: NodeContext: Rising anger. DRUG-nin RAK-kah. 'Fucking tool'

Mutineers_121.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_121.text: Gh'rack. Get you gone, before I get you gone.
Mutineers_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player.NodeContext: Sighs, was hoping to rob the player. GRACK = dammit.

Mutineers_96.speaker: Player
Mutineers_96.text: Depends. What do you need done?

Mutineers_41.speaker: Player
Mutineers_41.text: If you're offering me a job, I'm not interested.

Mutineers_36.speaker: Player
Mutineers_36.text: Please. I've already got more coin than you could carry.

Mutineers_69.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_69.text: That right? And wouldn't you know - my pockets are mighty light.

Mutineers_120.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers_120.context: CinematicNodeContext: To BrithvarNodeContext: A warning - telling Brithvar to shut up.

Mutineers_98.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_98.text: Shut your trap, Kur. The rakkah's got gold for grabbing.

Mutineers_40.speaker: Player
Mutineers_40.text: It was a joke. I'm as poor as a pauper.

Mutineers_85.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_85.text: A shitty joke, too - I ain't hearing no laughs. Now you want gold or not?

Mutineers_112.speaker: Player
Mutineers_112.text: You want my coin? Just try and take it.

Mutineers_55.speaker: Player
Mutineers_55.text: Fine - I'm a True Soul. What do you plan to do about it?

Mutineers_137.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_137.text: Collect my due pay for starters. Blade ready, Kur?

Mutineers_13.speaker: Player
Mutineers_13.text: You're imagining things. I would never bow to the Absolute.
Mutineers_13.context: InternalNodeContext: this node for those who don't have REALLY_DEEPGNOME

Mutineers_54.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_54.text: Could be you're right. Something's different with you.

Mutineers_2.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers_2.text: *The slightest of breezes slips through your skull.*
Mutineers_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers_114.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_114.text: Ain't fooling me. Only you Absolute-lickers get my mind wobbling.

Mutineers_22.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_22.text: Time we took our due. Your blade ready, Kur?

Mutineers_106.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers_106.text: Drop it, Brithvar. You chop this one, and Nere won't pay a damned copper.

Mutineers_20.speaker: Player
Mutineers_20.text: I was a True Soul. That cult lied to me - now I want revenge.

Mutineers_127.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_127.text: In that case, I got a proposal. Want to earn some gold?

Mutineers_67.speaker: Player
Mutineers_67.text: Use your head - can you imagine a deep gnome being picked as a True Soul?

Mutineers_122.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_122.text: Fair point. Pipsqueak like you is hardly gonna inspire fear and awe, are you?

Mutineers_82.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_82.text: Drugnin' True Souls. Can still smell Nere from behind that damned wall.
Mutineers_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind reading node, no lip sync

Mutineers_123.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_123.text: I feel you poking around. And I'll have your head for it!

Mutineers_14.speaker: Player
Mutineers_14.text: That 'stench' is just psionic resonance - a remnant of our ancestors' enslavement by illithids.

Mutineers_81.speaker: Player
Mutineers_81.text: What I am matters not. You seek retribution - I want to help.

Mutineers_21.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_21.text: You don't leave 'til I get my due.

Mutineers_94.speaker: Player
Mutineers_94.text: Go on, try it. I've been itching for a fight.

Mutineers_64.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_64.text: You don't need to ask twice. Your blade ready, Kur?
Mutineers_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Second sentence addressed to Kur

Mutineers_72.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_72.text: Fine. Spill what you want, True Soul, before I choke on your stench.

Mutineers_65.speaker: Player
Mutineers_65.text: I heard you talking. I want Nere out - and you have a lead.

Mutineers_104.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_104.text: I ain't parleying with more Twat-Souls - just want my coin. Your blade ready, Kur?
Mutineers_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Second sentence addressed to Kur

Mutineers_63.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_63.text: I ain't parleying with more Twat-Souls - that stench don't lie.

Mutineers_135.speaker: Player
Mutineers_135.text: All I'm going to spill are your guts.

Mutineers_35.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_35.text: Big words - let's see you back them up.

Mutineers_62.speaker: Player
Mutineers_62.text: Just smile. Let him see the rage in your eyes.

Mutineers_90.speaker: Player
Mutineers_90.text: I want Nere out - and it sounds like you have a lead.

Mutineers_88.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_88.text: I ain't parleying with more Twat-Souls. And you got the stench.

LoyalFollowUp_49.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_49.text: Shit - True Soul Nere's nothing but grub-chow now.

LoyalFollowUp_34.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_34.text: Listen up, bastards - I'm taking charge. Clean your 'nads and pack up.
LoyalFollowUp_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

LoyalFollowUp_1.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_1.text: We're marching to Moonrise. And no death-curse'll be stopping us.
LoyalFollowUp_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

LoyalFollowUp_41.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_41.text: Time for the General to recognise us duergar that have been toiling 'round here.

LoyalFollowUp_37.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_37.text: What about the gnomes? What happens to them?

LoyalFollowUp_75.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_75.text: What - you'd think I'd just toss 'em? They're coming with me. A gift for the General.

LoyalFollowUp_53.speaker: Wyll
LoyalFollowUp_53.text: Speak up. You can't just let the clan keep them.

LoyalFollowUp_7.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_7.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

LoyalFollowUp_57.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_57.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
LoyalFollowUp_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

LoyalFollowUp_67.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_67.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

LoyalFollowUp_2.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_2.text: It's a tough journey. The gnomes will be a burden.

LoyalFollowUp_60.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_60.text: Shit - suppose you're right. No use hauling dead weight.

LoyalFollowUp_70.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_70.text: They will make a fine offering.

LoyalFollowUp_80.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_80.text: Hells yes. The General can't ignore a haul of fresh slaves.

LoyalFollowUp_40.speaker: Wyll
LoyalFollowUp_40.text: Your heart made of stone? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

LoyalFollowUp_77.speaker: Gale
LoyalFollowUp_77.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

LoyalFollowUp_22.speaker: Karlach
LoyalFollowUp_22.text: Whatever's wrong with you, I hope it's not contagious.

LoyalFollowUp_18.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_18.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

LoyalFollowUp_78.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_78.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

LoyalFollowUp_32.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_32.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

LoyalFollowUp_33.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_33.text: The gnomes are free. Now walk away, while I'm feeling generous.

LoyalFollowUp_90.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_90.text: Fine. Not looking to piss off a True Soul.

LoyalFollowUp_76.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_76.text: Then show me. And may the Absolute bless the victor!

LoyalFollowUp_85.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_85.text: Yeah? Well I won't give you lip - what the Absolute wants, She gets.

LoyalFollowUp_46.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_46.text: Gnomes - it's your lucky day. Get your squat arses moving, before I take a brand to them.
LoyalFollowUp_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

LoyalFollowUp_59.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_59.text: That head of yours must be mixed up. The slaves are for the General. End of.

LoyalFollowUp_14.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_14.text: Slaves could slow us down - if they survive the curse at all.

LoyalFollowUp_63.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_63.text: What the... you messing with my mind? I won't stand for it!

LoyalFollowUp_0.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_0.text: I... I was wrong. I gotta release them.

LoyalFollowUp_74.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_74.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

LoyalFollowUp_13.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_13.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

LoyalFollowUp_10.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_10.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

LoyalFollowUp_72.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_72.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

LoyalFollowUp_79.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_79.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

LoyalFollowUp_23.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_23.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

LoyalFollowUp_27.speaker: Narrator
LoyalFollowUp_27.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

LoyalFollowUp_25.speaker: Gale
LoyalFollowUp_25.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

LoyalFollowUp_19.speaker: Karlach
LoyalFollowUp_19.text: We're not letting that happen, are we?

LoyalFollowUp_44.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_44.text: This General sounds powerful. Who is he, exactly?

LoyalFollowUp_87.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_87.text: He's the Absolute's Chosen, the way Nere talked. Building an army at Moonrise - best of the best.

LoyalFollowUp_91.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_91.text: Now I'm in charge here, he'll make me a True Soul. Maybe even a Disciple.

LoyalFollowUp_31.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_31.text: The surface is dangerous. I'm not so sure it's safe to travel.

LoyalFollowUp_73.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_73.text: Absolute let Nere and Thrinn both get capped. She's not offin' me now.

LoyalFollowUp_88.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_88.text: She'll part the curse for me. I got complete faith.

LoyalFollowUp_9.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_9.text: You mentioned a death-curse. Is the journey so dangerous?

LoyalFollowUp_61.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_61.text: That curse chokes the air from here clear to Moonrise. Not that I'm worried.

LoyalFollowUp_81.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_81.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

LoyalFollowUp_52.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_52.context: NodeContext: za-VAHG. A battle cry leading to combat

LoyalFollowUp_42.speaker: Player
LoyalFollowUp_42.text: It's time I cut you down once and for all.

LoyalFollowUp_66.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_66.text: Smug words for a walking corpse. Zavagh!
LoyalFollowUp_66.context: NodeContext: za-VAHG. A battle cry leading to combat

LoyalFollowUp_4.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp_4.text: That death-curse be damned, I'm heading to Moonrise.

ElevatorWarning_51.speaker: Ward Magmar
ElevatorWarning_51.text: Shit. You got one of Nere's Moonlanterns, jargh?

ElevatorWarning_5.speaker: Ward Magmar
ElevatorWarning_5.text: One of them pixie-lamps. If you're headin' to Moonrise, you won't last without it.

ElevatorWarning_53.speaker: Ward Pistle
ElevatorWarning_53.text: Top-lands are clogged with the death-dark, choke you in no time.

ElevatorWarning_20.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_20.text: 'Death-dark'? Sounds like my kind of thing. What is it?

ElevatorWarning_26.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_26.text: I've seen much death already... I'll be careful.

ElevatorWarning_47.speaker: Ward Magmar
ElevatorWarning_47.text: You daft? It's there in the name. Shadows up there, black as the Lowerdark. A few sniffs could fell an ogre.

ElevatorWarning_21.speaker: Lae'zel
ElevatorWarning_21.text: The surface is within reach. But it may be foolish to press on before finding this Nere.

ElevatorWarning_46.speaker: Shadowheart
ElevatorWarning_46.text: No surprises that there's danger ahead, but we're getting closer. Perhaps we should seek out Nere while we can, though.

ElevatorWarning_9.speaker: Karlach
ElevatorWarning_9.text: Sounds like bad news. I'd just as soon get that Moonlantern off Nere.

ElevatorWarning_40.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_40.text: That Moonlantern is key to our survival. And that means freeing Nere.

ElevatorWarning_10.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_10.text: We need to press on. Nere is a distraction.

ElevatorWarning_22.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorWarning_22.text: I'm one of the reasons people fear the shadows, but even I'd rather investigate this Moonlantern before going to the surface.

ElevatorWarning_56.speaker: Wyll
ElevatorWarning_56.text: I'm not so keen on taking a shadow-nap, myself. We need to free Nere and get that Moonlantern.

ElevatorWarning_18.speaker: Gale
ElevatorWarning_18.text: 'Death-dark' doesn't sound very inviting. Can't say I fancy our chances without freeing Nere and getting that Moonlantern.

ElevatorWarning_32.speaker: Lae'zel
ElevatorWarning_32.text: He speaks of the shadow curse. Moonrise must be close, but it would be foolish to press on before seeking out this Nere.

ElevatorWarning_41.speaker: Shadowheart
ElevatorWarning_41.text: Sounds like the shadow curse. We must be getting close to Moonrise. Perhaps we should seek out this Nere while we can, though.

ElevatorWarning_12.speaker: Karlach
ElevatorWarning_12.text: Must be the shadow curse. We'll need Nere's lantern if we want to get through it.

ElevatorWarning_30.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_30.text: That Moonlantern is key to our survival. And that means freeing Nere.

ElevatorWarning_0.speaker: Lae'zel
ElevatorWarning_0.text: Chk - more time wasted. If only you feared the ghaik parasite half as much as you fear the dark.

ElevatorWarning_14.speaker: Shadowheart
ElevatorWarning_14.text: Let's just hope you're right. Otherwise we're just aiding the enemy.

ElevatorWarning_7.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorWarning_7.text: Afraid of the dark, are we? Very well - let us save Nere, if we must.
ElevatorWarning_7.context: NodeContext: [Astarion - with a sigh before 'very well']

ElevatorWarning_11.speaker: Wyll
ElevatorWarning_11.text: There we have it. Let 'Operation Free Nere' commence.

ElevatorWarning_44.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_44.text: Moonrise Towers holds the answers we seek. Curse or not, we can't turn back now.

ElevatorWarning_43.speaker: Lae'zel
ElevatorWarning_43.text: Forward, then. No curse will keep me from purification.

ElevatorWarning_48.speaker: Shadowheart
ElevatorWarning_48.text: Good. After all we've been through, this is hardly the time to falter.
ElevatorWarning_48.context: NodeContext: Approving of the player's decision to press onwards through danger to their goal

ElevatorWarning_13.speaker: Karlach
ElevatorWarning_13.text: You just want me to die in a cursed cloud so you can take my boots. Finally, the plot revealed.
ElevatorWarning_13.context: NodeContext: Kidding but grim, not too much levity.

ElevatorWarning_52.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorWarning_52.text: Excellent. The less time I have to spend with these underdwarves, the better. Present company excluded, of course.

ElevatorWarning_31.speaker: Wyll
ElevatorWarning_31.text: So we're going up there without the lantern? I hope you know what you're doing.

ElevatorWarning_16.speaker: Gale
ElevatorWarning_16.text: A stab in the dark it is...

ElevatorWarning_50.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorWarning_50.text: If the cure's in Moonrise, we should go, Nere and his lantern be damned. After all, 'shadows' will be the least of our worries if we start to turn.

ElevatorWarning_33.speaker: Wyll
ElevatorWarning_33.text: The shadow curse. We'll need that Moonlantern from Nere to survive the journey to Moonrise Towers.

ElevatorWarning_45.speaker: Gale
ElevatorWarning_45.text: We were warned about the curse. Can't say I fancy our chances without a Moonlantern.

ElevatorWarning_29.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_29.text: Thanks for sharing. I'll keep it in mind.

ElevatorWarning_54.speaker: Ward Magmar
ElevatorWarning_54.text: Go on, get some air. But don't go cursing me if that shadow-shit snuffs you.

ElevatorWarning_3.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_3.text: Whatever. I'm not afraid of a few shadows.

ElevatorWarning_55.speaker: Ward Magmar
ElevatorWarning_55.text: Well, damn. Then go on up, take a stroll. Long as you keep your lips off our ale, I don't give two shits.

ElevatorWarning_57.speaker: Ward Magmar
ElevatorWarning_57.text: So if you're headin' Moonrise-way, you ain't gettin' far. Not without one of Nere's pixie-lamps.

ElevatorWarning_4.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarning_4.text: Of course I do. Why do you ask?

ElevatorWarning_15.speaker: Ward Magmar
ElevatorWarning_15.text: I ask 'cause you ain't gettin' far without one of them pixie-lamps.

Rothe_01_0.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01_0.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

Rothe_01_1.speaker: Deep Rothé Calf
Rothe_01_1.context: NodeContext: Sad. Very young and frail sounding.

RebelGreedyExtort_89.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_89.text: Freeze it, cock-stench. We aren't done just yet.

RebelGreedyExtort_96.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_96.text: Nere and his Absolute wanks owed us a wad of coin. And the dregs on his corpse aren't gonna cut it.

RebelGreedyExtort_75.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_75.text: Pay up, and you get to slink away. Resist, and I gut you. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelGreedyExtort_52.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_52.text: We had a deal. You owe me, not the other way around.

RebelGreedyExtort_34.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_34.text: Deal's off, jargh. I told you to squish that floatin' eyeball. Now the damn thing's seen us put Nere down.

RebelGreedyExtort_59.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_59.text: Thanks to you, we got a cult-army on our tail. Now pay up - or I bleed you dry.

RebelGreedyExtort_13.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_13.text: Take me on, and you'll look like a fool. Walk away, and you save face.

RebelGreedyExtort_51.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_51.text: Drugh. Fine. Besides, we got shit to do. Gold ain't gonna hoard itself.

RebelGreedyExtort_73.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_73.text: I don't have that kind of gold on me.

RebelGreedyExtort_82.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_82.text: That so? Then your head should do nicely. Zavagh!
RebelGreedyExtort_82.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

RebelGreedyExtort_78.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_78.text: Drop it. I don't owe you anything.

RebelGreedyExtort_61.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_61.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

RebelGreedyExtort_9.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_9.text: You've got this backwards. You keep your head, and I pay you nothing.

RebelGreedyExtort_48.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_48.text: Drugnin' jargh. Have it your way.

RebelGreedyExtort_54.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_54.text: That was the wrong answer. Zavagh!
RebelGreedyExtort_54.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

RebelGreedyExtort_99.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_99.text: You've got this all wrong. I pay you nothing, and you keep your head.

RebelGreedyExtort_55.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_55.text: Gut me? Try it - doubt you'll even pierce skin.

RebelGreedyExtort_20.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_20.text: I killed Nere for you. That's payment enough.

RebelGreedyExtort_5.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_5.text: Psh. I'll let you keep breathin', and we'll call things square.

RebelGreedyExtort_6.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_6.text: Clan: grab your gear, wipe your arses.
RebelGreedyExtort_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

RebelGreedyExtort_85.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_85.text: Time I scrammed before more pricks from Moonrise Towers move in.

RebelGreedyExtort_36.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_36.text: And the slaves? What about them?

RebelGreedyExtort_32.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_32.text: Clan property. They come with us.

RebelGreedyExtort_92.speaker: Wyll
RebelGreedyExtort_92.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.

RebelGreedyExtort_44.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_44.text: Set them free, or I will thrash you like I thrashed Nere.

RebelGreedyExtort_18.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_18.text: Won't hear me argue. Your mouth's got the might to back it.

RebelGreedyExtort_30.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_30.text: Gnome-pricks: you're off the hook. Scram, before I get my senses.
RebelGreedyExtort_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

RebelGreedyExtort_79.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_79.text: Then do it, ya shit. We'll see who thrashes who.

RebelGreedyExtort_2.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_2.text: The gnomes go free, and you get to live. Everybody wins.

RebelGreedyExtort_21.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_21.text: Try it, ya uppity shit, see what happens.

RebelGreedyExtort_24.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_24.text: I've reconsidered our deal, Brithvar. Free the slaves, or this place becomes your tomb.

RebelGreedyExtort_71.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_71.text: Let the gnomes go. They'll just slow you down.

RebelGreedyExtort_67.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_67.text: Mm - you got a point. Likely to be all hobbled up, what with the lashings.

RebelGreedyExtort_33.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_33.text: Hardly. They drag their feet, and I'll scorch their arses. Works every time.

RebelGreedyExtort_64.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_64.text: Good idea. They're a valuable asset.

RebelGreedyExtort_50.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_50.text: Born to serve, my father said. I'll keep 'em busy.

RebelGreedyExtort_37.speaker: Wyll
RebelGreedyExtort_37.text: Have you no heart? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

RebelGreedyExtort_100.speaker: Gale
RebelGreedyExtort_100.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

RebelGreedyExtort_22.speaker: Karlach
RebelGreedyExtort_22.text: My gods. What in all Nine Hells is wrong with you?!

RebelGreedyExtort_60.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_60.text: Mm. For a jargh, you got smarts.

RebelGreedyExtort_91.speaker: Gale
RebelGreedyExtort_91.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

RebelGreedyExtort_84.speaker: Karlach
RebelGreedyExtort_84.text: Pft. Sure, they can take the gnomes. Over our dead bodies. Right?

RebelGreedyExtort_72.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_72.text: What makes Moonrise Towers such a threat?

RebelGreedyExtort_1.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_1.text: Your brain going mushy, jargh? That's where those Absolute-freaks hole up.

RebelGreedyExtort_80.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_80.text: Goblins, drow, gnolls, even humans - ain't no one they won't try to turn. They've gathered a damned army.

RebelGreedyExtort_76.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_76.text: The way I hear tell, some prick there calls the shots. The General, Nere called him.

RebelGreedyExtort_95.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_95.text: And there ain't no way I'm sticking around long enough to meet him.

RebelGreedyExtort_0.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_0.text: Get moving. If I see you slavers again, I'll tear you apart.

RebelGreedyExtort_68.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_68.text: Please. We catch your scent, and you'll get sliced 'fore you can bat your left eye.

RebelGreedyExtort_66.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_66.text: Now lug your arse someplace else - I got to get cracking.
RebelGreedyExtort_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

RebelGreedyExtort_45.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_45.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

RebelGreedyExtort_47.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_47.text: Your wish is my command, jargh.

RebelGreedyExtort_58.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_58.text: Restitution, my arse. You'll find what you need on Nere's corpse.

RebelGreedyExtort_43.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_43.text: You rakkah. Good thing you ain't one of mine - I'd be sliding a cane up your hole and twisting.

RebelGreedyExtort_83.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort_83.text: Listen, coward. We had an agreement, and I don't take kindly to oathbreakers.

RebelGreedyExtort_25.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_25.text: Shit - I've seen this jargh fight. Drugnin' animal. But sooner die than lose face.
RebelGreedyExtort_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is reading Brithvar's mind

RebelGreedyExtort_62.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort_62.text: You messing in heads? I won't stand for that shit. Zavagh!

RotheDiscussion_16.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_16.text: *The beast flashes a message of comfort. But his eyes betray his concern.*
RotheDiscussion_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RotheDiscussion_27.speaker: Deep Rothé Calf
RotheDiscussion_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flashing above both rothe.NodeContext: Sad. Frustrated.

RotheDiscussion_5.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_5.text: Do not think on it further. Rest. I will see you safe.
RotheDiscussion_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flashing above both rotheNodeContext: Trying to be comforting. Not doing a great job,

RotheDiscussion_35.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_35.text: *The rothé grunt softly at each other. Small lights flash about their heads in quick, erratic patterns.*
RotheDiscussion_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small lights flashing above rothe heads

RotheDiscussion_36.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_36.text: Still your body and quietly observe.

RotheDiscussion_30.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_30.text: *One of the beasts seems exhausted. His lights flash in slow, methodical beats.*
RotheDiscussion_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Deep Rothe Calf's lights flash slowly

RotheDiscussion_65.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_65.text: *You recognise the spell - Dancing Lights. It is how rothé communicate with each other.*
RotheDiscussion_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RotheDiscussion_24.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_24.text: *The beasts continue their discussion, lights flickering above them.*
RotheDiscussion_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RotheDiscussion_42.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_42.text: *You discern subtle emotions in the lights' patterns. There is pain, sadness - and fear.*
RotheDiscussion_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RotheDiscussion_9.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_9.text: *That fear runs deep, stretching back across generations.*
RotheDiscussion_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RotheDiscussion_7.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_7.text: *The lights must mean something, but you can't interpret the flashes.*
RotheDiscussion_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

RotheDiscussion_10.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_10.text: *One beast notices you and dulls his lights, ending the conversation.*
RotheDiscussion_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Elder Rothe dulls his lights

RotheDiscussion_46.speaker: Deep Rothé Calf
RotheDiscussion_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rotheNodeContext: Pleading, Hopeful.

RotheDiscussion_63.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_63.text: Rest, little one. But do not take long - I feel his shadow.
RotheDiscussion_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder RotheNodeContext: Stern but trying not to be too cruel

RotheDiscussion_59.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_59.text: I heard his name whispered. The rock shivers from the sound. The Ketheric Thorm.
RotheDiscussion_59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe
NodeContext: Increasingly insistent but not too loud or angry.

RotheDiscussion_47.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_47.text: *Ketheric Thorm, the Absolute's Chosen. Even in these depths, he has left his vicious mark.*
RotheDiscussion_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_40.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_40.text: Ketheric Thorm's influence stretches far. What was he doing down here?

RotheDiscussion_21.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_21.text: *The Absolute's Chosen, Ketheric Thorm. So vast is his repute that even the beasts bellow his name.*
RotheDiscussion_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_6.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_6.text: Tell me what you can about Ketheric Thorm.

RotheDiscussion_15.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_15.text: Mm. Mighty elf, cloaked in darkness. Ten masters ago, and ten more. But I remember.
RotheDiscussion_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_25.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_25.text: There was the work, and the blood. There was the Thorm's army. There was the hellbeast that broke them.
RotheDiscussion_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_51.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_51.text: The Ketheric Thorm's name faded into stone. Until the Nere came.
RotheDiscussion_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_43.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_43.text: Impressive memory. How old are you exactly?

RotheDiscussion_45.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_45.text: I outlived my mother, and her mother's mother, and many mothers beyond.
RotheDiscussion_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_34.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_34.text: Blessed to see many live. Cursed to see many die.
RotheDiscussion_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_26.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_26.text: What kind of hellbeast could have destroyed Ketheric's army?

RotheDiscussion_17.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_17.text: That was a long time ago. What does Nere have to do with Ketheric?

RotheDiscussion_39.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_39.text: I know not so I say not. Yet I hear his name again, said by the shadows.
RotheDiscussion_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_49.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_49.text: Hellbeast? You mean like me? Horns?

RotheDiscussion_4.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_54.speaker: Elder Rothé
RotheDiscussion_54.text: I saw tusks and flesh, smelled fire and eggs. It came with the mask-men - crashing and smashing.
RotheDiscussion_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_52.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_52.text: You honour me with your ancient wisdom.

RotheDiscussion_55.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_55.text: *Ketheric Thorm - a familiar name. Halsin mentioned his stronghold deep underground.*
RotheDiscussion_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_11.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_11.text: Do you mean Ketheric Thorm, the Dark Justiciar commander?

RotheDiscussion_12.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_12.text: *Ketheric Thorm - an inescapable name. His legacy has shadowed the region, above ground and under.*
RotheDiscussion_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_38.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_38.text: You're not the only one who fears Ketheric Thorm. What do you know of him?

RotheDiscussion_18.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_18.text: *The name means little to you, yet your heart pulses to its rhythm. Thorm. Thorm.*
RotheDiscussion_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above the Elder Rothe

RotheDiscussion_58.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion_58.text: You fear this Ketheric Thorm. Who is he?

RotheDiscussion_57.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion_57.text: *The two rothé moan quietly as lights flash about their heads.*
RotheDiscussion_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The two Rothé paw the ground in irritation as lights flash about their heads.*

RebelsExtort_75.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_75.text: Hold up, jargh. Y-you ain't just walking away.
RebelsExtort_75.context: NodeContext: Aggressive in their words, but something hesitant. They're afraid of you, they just don't want to show it.

RebelsExtort_40.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_40.text: You got Brithvar chopped - and I still haven't seen a damned coin for my trouble.

RebelsExtort_17.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_17.text: You owe - what's the word? Restitution.  ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelsExtort_54.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_54.text: That, or - or I add your corpse to the heap. Which is it?

RebelsExtort_93.speaker: Narrator
RebelsExtort_93.text: *You sense hesitation. The duergar talks tough, but fears you.*

RebelsExtort_35.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_35.text: I had a deal with Brithvar. You owe me, not the other way around.

RebelsExtort_96.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_96.text: Deal's off, jargh. He told you to squish that floatin' eyeball. Now the damn thing's seen us kill Nere.

RebelsExtort_60.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_60.text: Clan's got a cult-army on its hands thanks to you. So pay up. I'll take gold - or your head.

RebelsExtort_55.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_55.text: You're afraid, and you should be. Ask for money again, and I'll gut you.

RebelsExtort_58.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_58.text: Stinking rakkah. If Brithvar was here...

RebelsExtort_87.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_87.text: Clan, wrap it up. We've scraped this place for all its worth.
RebelsExtort_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

RebelsExtort_79.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_79.text: It's time I scram, before the buggers at Moonrise charge in.

RebelsExtort_92.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_92.text: And the slaves? What about them?

RebelsExtort_3.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_3.text: They belong to the clan. They're coming with us.

RebelsExtort_77.speaker: Wyll
RebelsExtort_77.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.

RebelsExtort_66.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_66.text: You sure they're worth dying over?

RebelsExtort_18.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_18.text: Set them free, or I will thrash you like I thrashed Nere.

RebelsExtort_7.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_7.text: These shitheads aren't worth the hassle. You got yourself a deal.

RebelsExtort_56.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_56.text: You're free, squatties. Get your legs moving, before I change my damn mind.
RebelsExtort_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

RebelsExtort_24.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_24.text: Go on, then. Been itching to cut you down a peg.

RebelsExtort_38.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_38.text: Let the gnomes go. They'll just slow you down.

RebelsExtort_22.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_22.text: Yeh might be right about that. The more bodies we got, the slower we move.

RebelsExtort_68.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_68.text: Nah. They slow us down, I hold fire to their arses. You should see 'em dance!

RebelsExtort_103.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_103.text: Good idea. They're a valuable asset.

RebelsExtort_67.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_67.text: Damn right. We'll keep them busy - this isn't their last dig.

RebelsExtort_76.speaker: Wyll
RebelsExtort_76.text: Your heart made of stone? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

RebelsExtort_15.speaker: Gale
RebelsExtort_15.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

RebelsExtort_29.speaker: Karlach
RebelsExtort_29.text: Whoa. What?! You can't be serious.

RebelsExtort_69.speaker: Gale
RebelsExtort_69.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

RebelsExtort_27.speaker: Karlach
RebelsExtort_27.text: Absolutely not. The gnomes walk free. Right?

RebelsExtort_80.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_80.text: What makes Moonrise Towers such a threat?

RebelsExtort_51.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_51.text: Place is swarming with Absolute-buggers - a whole army. And I ain't gonna mess about with them.
RebelsExtort_51.context: NodeContext: Abs-so-LUTE buggers. As in, god-shaggers.

RebelsExtort_26.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_26.text: Some General up there giving the orders, the way Nere told it.

RebelsExtort_94.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_94.text: They got goblins, drow, gnolls, even humans - ain't no one they won't try to turn. The clans included.

RebelsExtort_2.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_2.text: Get moving. If I see you slavers again, I'll tear you apart.

RebelsExtort_72.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_72.text: You think? I catch so much as a whiff of you, and I'll have you flayed and fried up for dinner.

RebelsExtort_101.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_101.text: Now move out of here - I got shit to be doing.
RebelsExtort_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

RebelsExtort_31.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_31.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

RebelsExtort_46.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_46.text: You don't need to ask twice, jargh.

RebelsExtort_12.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_12.text: You're no Brithvar. Let me go, and I won't humiliate you in battle. Deal?

RebelsExtort_102.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_102.text: I - fine. Can't dig for gold when I'm dead, eh?

RebelsExtort_104.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_104.text: Don't be ridiculous. I don't have that kind of gold.

RebelsExtort_30.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_30.text: Then I'll have to see what price your head fetches. Zavagh!
RebelsExtort_30.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

RebelsExtort_85.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_85.text: You're mad if you think I owe you a single coin.

RebelsExtort_99.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_99.text: That so? Then your corpse should be more than willing. Zavagh!
RebelsExtort_99.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

RebelsExtort_1.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_1.text: You've got this backwards. You keep your head, and I pay you nothing.

RebelsExtort_97.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_97.text: I... fine. You ain't worth the trouble anyway.

RebelsExtort_19.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_19.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

RebelsExtort_59.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_59.text: I killed Nere for you. That's payment enough.

RebelsExtort_74.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_74.text: Shit. That's how it is, eh?
RebelsExtort_74.context: NodeContext: Said with a sigh at the beginning.

RebelsExtort_43.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_43.text: AHH! SHIT! F-fine, I'm not dealing with whatever that was.
RebelsExtort_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: He steps back scared at the roarNodeContext: Scared by roar, then a touch embarrassed

RebelsExtort_37.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_37.text: Hah! Did you just roar at me, you freak? Zavagh!

RebelsExtort_53.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_53.text: I can smell your fear so bad I can taste it. Go beg someone else.

RebelsExtort_49.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort_49.text: Restitution, my arse. You'll find what you need on Nere's corpse.

RebelsExtort_91.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_91.text: Shit - fine. Never could see eye to eye with a clan-sen.

RebelsExtort_41.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_41.text: Drugnin' Brithvar. I'm lost without him. He'd have this jargh pissin' with fear.

RebelsExtort_36.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort_36.text: You - you're in my head, aren't you? That ain't right, damn it. Zavagh!

Mutineers_FollowUp_56.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_56.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

Mutineers_FollowUp_51.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_51.text: Here's your cut. Extra too, like I promised. ([463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Mutineers_FollowUp_28.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_28.text: Here's your cut. I always keep my word. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Mutineers_FollowUp_40.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_40.text: Clan: grab your gear, wipe your arses.
Mutineers_FollowUp_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

Mutineers_FollowUp_24.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_24.text: Time I scrammed before more pricks from Moonrise Towers move in.

Mutineers_FollowUp_21.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_21.text: And the slaves? What about them?

Mutineers_FollowUp_18.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_18.text: Clan property. They come with us.

Mutineers_FollowUp_41.speaker: Wyll
Mutineers_FollowUp_41.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.

Mutineers_FollowUp_5.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_5.text: The gnomes go free. You get to live. Everybody wins.

Mutineers_FollowUp_44.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_44.text: Try it, ya uppity shit, see what happens.

Mutineers_FollowUp_32.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_32.text: Set them free, or I will thrash you like I thrashed Nere.

Mutineers_FollowUp_31.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_31.text: Won't hear me argue. Your mouth's got the might to back it.

Mutineers_FollowUp_2.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_2.text: Gnome-pricks: you're off the hook. Scram, before I get my senses.
Mutineers_FollowUp_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

Mutineers_FollowUp_43.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_43.text: Then do it, ya shit. We'll see who thrashes who.

Mutineers_FollowUp_67.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_67.text: Let the gnomes go. They'll just slow you down.

Mutineers_FollowUp_10.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_10.text: Mm - you got a point. Likely to be all hobbled up, what with the lashings.

Mutineers_FollowUp_36.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_36.text: Hardly. They drag their feet, and I'll scorch their arses. Works every time.

Mutineers_FollowUp_69.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_69.text: Good idea. They're a valuable asset.

Mutineers_FollowUp_68.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_68.text: Born to serve, my father said. I'll keep 'em busy.

Mutineers_FollowUp_30.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_30.text: Mm. For a jargh, you got smarts.

Mutineers_FollowUp_39.speaker: Wyll
Mutineers_FollowUp_39.text: Have you no heart? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

Mutineers_FollowUp_42.speaker: Gale
Mutineers_FollowUp_42.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

Mutineers_FollowUp_17.speaker: Karlach
Mutineers_FollowUp_17.text: You can't be serious. What the fuck is wrong with you?

Mutineers_FollowUp_4.speaker: Gale
Mutineers_FollowUp_4.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

Mutineers_FollowUp_57.speaker: Karlach
Mutineers_FollowUp_57.text: No way we're letting these bastards take those gnomes. Right?

Mutineers_FollowUp_16.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_16.text: What makes Moonrise Towers such a threat?

Mutineers_FollowUp_37.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_37.text: Your brain going mushy, jargh? That's where those Absolute-freaks hole up.

Mutineers_FollowUp_48.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_48.text: Goblins, drow, gnolls, even humans - ain't no one they won't try to turn.

Mutineers_FollowUp_34.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_34.text: The way I hear tell, some prick there calls the shots. The General, Nere called him.

Mutineers_FollowUp_14.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_14.text: And there ain't no way I'm sticking around long enough to meet him.

Mutineers_FollowUp_45.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_45.text: Get moving. If I see you slavers again, I'll tear you apart.

Mutineers_FollowUp_29.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_29.text: Please. We catch your scent, and you'll get sliced 'fore you can bat your left eye.

Mutineers_FollowUp_60.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_60.text: Now lug your arse someplace else - I got to get cracking.
Mutineers_FollowUp_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

Mutineers_FollowUp_50.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_50.text: Leave - and take the slaves with you. Before I change my mind.

Mutineers_FollowUp_58.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_58.text: And the gold you owe me?

Mutineers_FollowUp_64.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_64.text: Someone's gone pickin' my pockets, ya chaff. You want coin, there's plenty of corpses to sack.

Mutineers_FollowUp_46.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_46.text: Good idea. I'll start by adding your corpse to the pile.

Mutineers_FollowUp_54.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_54.text: Very well. I'll rummage what I can.

Mutineers_FollowUp_63.speaker: Player
Mutineers_FollowUp_63.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

Mutineers_FollowUp_61.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp_61.text: Your wish is my command, jargh.

Rothe_03_0.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03_0.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03_0.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_03_2.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03_2.text: Hmm? Urgh. Are those two still talking?
Rothe_03_2.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_03_3.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_03_3.text: *The creature huffs in irritation as she closes her eyes.*

Checkpoint_133.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint_133.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint_39.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_39.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint_1.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint_1.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint_111.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_111.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint_111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint_44.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint_44.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint_112.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_112.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint_83.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_83.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint_123.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint_123.text: I am Lae'zel - daughter of Gith, defender of Vlaakith. And I am no slave.

Checkpoint_33.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_33.text: Ooh - that one's feisty. Thrinn's gonna knock the snot right out of her.

Checkpoint_147.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_147.text: I am a True Soul. And you will treat me with respect.

Checkpoint_54.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_54.text: I'm here to see the sergeant. I have her boots.

Checkpoint_103.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_103.text: I was told to report to the sergeant.

Checkpoint_38.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
Checkpoint_38.text: Deep gnomes, mostly. Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging.

Checkpoint_71.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_71.text: It's a problem, all right. I'm a True Soul, and you will treat me like one.

Checkpoint_20.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_108.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint_108.text: Aye, they speak true. Found the hoon sailing Gekh's skiff.

Checkpoint_96.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_96.text: I'm not here to work. I'm here for the sergeant.

Checkpoint_11.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint_11.text: Aye. They sniffed up Gekh's corpse. Found the hoon sailing his skiff.

Checkpoint_60.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_150.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint_150.text: Aye. One of those Absolute crackpots. Found the hoon sailing Gekh's skiff.

Checkpoint_49.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_49.text: I don't care about slaves. Now if you'll excuse me.

Checkpoint_5.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_5.text: Hold up, jargh. You ain't goin'... nngh...
Checkpoint_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.NodeContext: Jargh = Fool. ZHARG.

Checkpoint_68.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint_68.text: *You feel the slightest of stirrings in your head. The duergar is not infected, yet your minds resonate.*
Checkpoint_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: No mind-meld, just a slight head-touch for the player and Morghal.

Checkpoint_79.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_79.text: I'll be - you ain't shittin'. Felt the tingle.
Checkpoint_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal start with her right hand touching her head. This is the end of the discomfort from the pain

Checkpoint_55.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_55.text: Your Twat-Soul chum owes us a load of coin. You want through? Make a donation. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Checkpoint_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal grins evilly and brandishes a blade

Checkpoint_154.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_154.text: I don't have that kind of gold on me.

Checkpoint_0.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_0.text: Well, shit. Good thing I was just takin' the piss.
Checkpoint_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and end by sheathing the blade.

Checkpoint_152.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint_152.text: I am keen to sever Nere's head. A shame we must do the favour of freeing him first.

Checkpoint_84.speaker: Shadowheart
Checkpoint_84.text: Seems we'll have to free Nere before we can collect the bounty on his head.

Checkpoint_27.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_27.text: Free the drow, take his head, get out of here in one piece. Easy as one, two, three.

Checkpoint_134.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint_134.text: As for the gnome slaves, pay no heed. A bleeding heart is an unnecessary burden.

Checkpoint_6.speaker: Shadowheart
Checkpoint_6.text: Might be worth talking to some of the gnome slaves - before they're worked to death, that is.

Checkpoint_113.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_113.text: Don't forget the gnomes. I'm not leaving them with their captors.

Checkpoint_122.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint_122.text: Let's do the job and get out of here. All this talk of slaves is just depressing.

Checkpoint_97.speaker: Wyll
Checkpoint_97.text: Not to mention - they keep gnomes as slaves. Though not for much longer, if I have a say.

Checkpoint_16.speaker: Gale
Checkpoint_16.text: There's the matter of the gnomes, too. Wouldn't do to stand by and keep them enslaved.

Checkpoint_40.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint_40.text: We have to free Nere before we can take his head? Sounds like a lot of wasted effort.

Checkpoint_137.speaker: Wyll
Checkpoint_137.text: We're closing in on Nere. But if we want his head, we'll need to free him first.

Checkpoint_52.speaker: Gale
Checkpoint_52.text: So we must save the drow first, then sever his head after... Pleasantries like that make me quite homesick.

Checkpoint_125.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_125.text: But I'm warning you - that Twat-Soul ain't settle up soon, there'll be hell to pay for the lot of you cult-buggers.

Checkpoint_47.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint_47.text: Come - and pay no heed to their slaves. A bleeding heart is an unnecessary burden.

Checkpoint_82.speaker: Shadowheart
Checkpoint_82.text: Charming - and slave drivers to boot. Might be worth talking to the gnomes before they're worked to death.

Checkpoint_81.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_81.text: I've seen nasty, but these guys are on their own level. I have a feeling this is gonna end badly.

Checkpoint_109.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint_109.text: All the charm and wit you'd expect from a slaver. Even a slaver of gnomes.

Checkpoint_99.speaker: Wyll
Checkpoint_99.text: Did I hear right - they keep gnomes as slaves? Not for much longer, if the Blade has a say.

Checkpoint_135.speaker: Gale
Checkpoint_135.text: She really oozes charm, this one. Perhaps we should spare a thought for the wretches she's enslaved.

Checkpoint_143.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_143.text: I'll be shagged to Shanatar. Shit's looking up.
Checkpoint_143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and takes gold from player, then sheathes the blade

Checkpoint_23.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_23.text: I'm not giving you a single coin.

Checkpoint_130.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_130.text: Unclog your hole - just shitting around.
Checkpoint_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and end by sheathing the blade.

Checkpoint_107.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_107.text: I'll take your head before you take my gold.

Checkpoint_140.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_140.text: I'd rather cut my own throat than hand my coin to a bloody duergar.

Checkpoint_51.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_51.text: Shit. Would love to see that. Now unclog your dwarf-hole - I'm just bustin' your 'nads.
Checkpoint_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles and end by sheathing the blade.

Checkpoint_37.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_37.text: In that case, let's talk business. Your Twat-Soul friend Nere caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a hornet's arse.

Checkpoint_9.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
Checkpoint_9.text: Coupla gnome slaves stuck with him too, little bastards.

Checkpoint_95.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_95.text: You Absolute-shaggers owe us a crap-load of coin. You want through? Make a donation. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Checkpoint_124.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_124.text: Did you say you keep slaves here?

Checkpoint_46.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_46.text: Not a problem in the slightest.

Checkpoint_87.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_87.text: Good. Now cough up the coin - I got shit to do.

Checkpoint_145.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_145.text: Fine. Now pay the toll, jargh. I'm tired of your face.

Checkpoint_14.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_14.text: I've got no use for slavers. Including you.

Checkpoint_149.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_149.text: You'll work through it, jargh. Now pay up - don't got all day.

Checkpoint_26.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_26.text: Is that a threat? Because that is a problem.

Checkpoint_77.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_77.text: I don't make threats - I educate. Now hand over the coin and get moving.

Checkpoint_12.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_12.text: If there's a mark on those gnomes, it will be.

Checkpoint_100.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_100.text: Yeah, I bet you'll mess us up good, squeaker. Now pay up, or sod off.

Checkpoint_65.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_65.text: I don't think you understand - I'm gutting you here and now.

Checkpoint_114.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_114.text: I'll be. You're one of them cult-freaks. Felt the tingle.
Checkpoint_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal start with her right hand touching her head. This is the end of the discomfort from the pain

Checkpoint_85.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_85.text: I've got no use for slavers. Including you.

Checkpoint_92.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_92.text: That right? And just what do... nngh...
Checkpoint_92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_2.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_2.text: Is that a threat? Because that is a problem.

Checkpoint_106.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_106.text: Shit. Just 'cause you're duergar don't make you clan. What... nngh...
Checkpoint_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_30.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_30.text: If there's a mark on those gnomes, it will be.

Checkpoint_105.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_105.text: Shit. You think a runt like you's gonna... nngh...
Checkpoint_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_42.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_42.text: Keep talking to me like that, and I'll clap you in irons myself.

Checkpoint_61.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_61.text: That what you think? Shit. The Weaver herself couldn't... nngh...
Checkpoint_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_19.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_19.text: I'll just kill you, then. No problem at all.

Checkpoint_34.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint_34.text: If you lust for blood, so be it - though scouting may be the wiser option.

Checkpoint_69.speaker: Shadowheart
Checkpoint_69.text: There could be scores of duergar here. Let's not pick a fight until we know how the odds are stacked.

Checkpoint_22.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_22.text: I'm ready to go, but maybe we should wait before provoking these pricks.

Checkpoint_63.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_63.text: I hear you right? You want a thrashing?

Checkpoint_117.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_117.text: I want you to try to give me one.

Checkpoint_93.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_93.text: I'll choke the life out of you, shit-for-brains.

Checkpoint_156.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_156.text: That's what I figured. I... nngh...
Checkpoint_156.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_151.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint_151.text: And I was worried we weren't on the same page. Let's spill their guts.

Checkpoint_36.speaker: Wyll
Checkpoint_36.text: I reckon this place is swarming with slavers. I hope you know what you're doing.

Checkpoint_89.speaker: Gale
Checkpoint_89.text: Uhm - I think you might be about to bite off more duergar than you can chew.

Checkpoint_129.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_129.text: To bind another in slavery is abhorrent. As are you.

Checkpoint_57.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_57.text: Don't worry about what I'm here for - I'll be on my way.

Checkpoint_121.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_121.text: Disgusting. I assure you, we are not 'ploughing'.

Checkpoint_17.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_17.text: Pity for you. A good plough might dislodge that stick from your... nngh...
Checkpoint_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_128.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_128.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Checkpoint_35.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_35.text: Shit - you're as plucky as you are pretty. Sergeant might have two uses for you.

Checkpoint_141.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint_141.text: Close your hatch, Morghal. They're one of those Absolute crackpots. Found the hoon sailing Gekh's skiff.

Checkpoint_158.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal touches her head with her right hand, as if in pain.

Checkpoint_115.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_115.text: I am Lae'zel - daughter of Gith, defender of Queen Vlaakith. And I am no slave.

Checkpoint_90.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_90.text: Well la-dee-damn-da. I'm empress of this dock, and when I say 'jump', you ask 'how high?'

Checkpoint_78.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint_78.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Checkpoint_91.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_91.text: Ooh - this one's feisty. Thrinn's gonna knock the snot right out of him.

Checkpoint_139.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
Checkpoint_139.text: Weapon at ready, lass - company's calling.
Checkpoint_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party arrives at shore on their boat. Line addressed to Morghal

Checkpoint_62.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_62.text: What do we got here? Dead hoon walking, seems like.
Checkpoint_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party disembarksNodeContext: Hoon = as spelled. An outsider.

Checkpoint_25.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint_25.text: Got any reason I shouldn't sever your head and toss it to the rothé?

Checkpoint_146.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint_146.text: Let her try. My thirst for blood has yet to be quenched.

Checkpoint_155.speaker: Shadowheart
Checkpoint_155.text: Let's try and keep this diplomatic. I'd rather not jump into another fight quite so soon.

Checkpoint_41.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_41.text: Not in the mood for another fight, believe it or not. Can we play nice?

Checkpoint_43.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint_43.text: Another belligerent dwarf? This is getting tiresome.

Checkpoint_73.speaker: Wyll
Checkpoint_73.text: I reckon diplomacy may be in order. The Blade could use a breather.

Checkpoint_31.speaker: Gale
Checkpoint_31.text: Let's not get into another scrape, shall we? Still catching my breath after the last one.

Checkpoint_24.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_24.text: Just let me through. I'm not looking for trouble.

Checkpoint_127.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_127.text: I'll be severing yours if it's all the same.

Rothe_02_0.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02_0.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

Rothe_02_1.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_02_1.text: *The beast focuses on his food - sternly ignoring you.*

HangedDrow_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
HangedDrow_Dead_25.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

HangedDrow_Dead_24.speaker: Executed Drow
HangedDrow_Dead_24.context: NodeContext: Jhaam is his name. Pronounced Zhahm.

HangedDrow_Dead_20.speaker: Executed Drow
HangedDrow_Dead_20.text: Cultists... threat to Baldur's Gate... Jaheira's orders...
HangedDrow_Dead_20.context: NodeContext: Jhaam is his name. Pronounced Zhahm.

HangedDrow_Dead_13.speaker: Lae'zel
HangedDrow_Dead_13.text: I'm not familiar with that name. A Harper leader, perhaps.

HangedDrow_Dead_21.speaker: Shadowheart
HangedDrow_Dead_21.text: Jaheira? Can't say I know the name.

HangedDrow_Dead_10.speaker: Karlach
HangedDrow_Dead_10.text: Hang on... High Harper Jaheira?! Saviour of Baldur's Gate? Incredible.

HangedDrow_Dead_30.speaker: Astarion
HangedDrow_Dead_30.text: The name sounds familiar - I hope we didn't meet on one of my little excursions.

HangedDrow_Dead_16.speaker: Wyll
HangedDrow_Dead_16.text: The name sounds familiar. A Harper leader, if I recall.

HangedDrow_Dead_23.speaker: Gale
HangedDrow_Dead_23.text: Hmmm, that name doesn't ring a bell.

HangedDrow_Dead_22.speaker: Executed Drow
HangedDrow_Dead_22.text: Last Light... safe haven... in shadows...

HangedDrow_Dead_31.speaker: Narrator
HangedDrow_Dead_31.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

HangedDrow_Dead_34.speaker: Narrator
HangedDrow_Dead_34.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

ElevatorWarningGnome_48.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome_48.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome_5.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome_5.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome_51.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome_51.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome_45.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome_45.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome_28.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome_28.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

ElevatorWarningGnome_37.speaker: Lae'zel
ElevatorWarningGnome_37.text: The surface is within reach. Forget Nere, forget the Moonlantern - I hardly fear a few shadows.

ElevatorWarningGnome_50.speaker: Shadowheart
ElevatorWarningGnome_50.text: No surprises that there's danger ahead, but at least we're getting closer. Leave Nere to rot - we should press on.

ElevatorWarningGnome_16.speaker: Karlach
